level.heading: Criminal penalties.
level.text: Any person who commits any of the acts prohibited by § 47-2419, either knowingly or having reason to know he is doing so, or who fails to comply with any of the requirements of § 47-2420, shall, upon conviction thereof, be fined not more than the amount set forth in [§ 22-3571.01] or imprisoned for not more than 3 years, or both.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 13-313 inserted the section symbol in the section heading.
D.C. Law 15-354 substituted "fined not more than $5,000 or imprisoned for not more than 3 years, or both" for "subject to the penalties under § 47-2414(a)".
The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-317 substituted "not more than the amount set forth in [§ 22-3571.01]" for "not more than $5,000".

level.heading: Temporary Addition of Section
level.text: For temporary (225 day) addition, see § 2(b) of Gray Market Cigarette Prohibition Temporary Act of 2000 (D.C. Law 13-164, October 4, 2000, law notification 47 DCR 8611).

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary (90-day) addition, see 2(b) of the Grey market Cigarette Prohibition Emergency Act of 2000 (D.C. Act 13-350, June 5, 2000, 47 DCR 5022).
For temporary (90-day) addition, see § 2 of the Grey market Cigarette Prohibition Congressional Review Emergency Act of 2000 (D.C. Act 13-413, August 14, 2000, 47 DCR 7291).
For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 286(o) of the Criminal Fine Proportionality Emergency Act of 2013 (D.C. Act 20-45, April 1, 2013, 60 DCR 5400, 20 DCSTAT 1300).

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Applicability of D.C. Law 19-317: Section 401 of D.C. Law 19-317 provided that the act shall apply only to offenses committed on or after June 11, 2013.
